abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Financial
            Management (PFM) Technical Assistance Project for Moldova
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory,
            risk to development outcome was substantial, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: it is essential that ministries of finance
            implementing complex information and communication
            technology (ICT) projects retain advisers with expertise in
            managing large and complex ICT systems implementation
            projects. Projects can be more effective if PFM reforms are
            not linked to the implementation of the financial management
            information system (FMIS). A realistic time frame for the
            design and implementation of a complex FMIS project is seven
            to eight years. Project extensions should be long enough to
            allow the stakeholders to bring about changes in project
            performance. The design of World Bank standard bidding
            documents for information technology (IT) projects should be
            reviewed to assess their suitability. Resistance to change
            should be anticipated and the project should retain
            consensus building and communications arrangements
            throughout implementation.
